meanings.definition: Providing an incentive or encouragement to act or achieve something.
meanings.sent1: The motivational speech was very motivative, making everyone feel inspired to do their best.
meanings.sent2: Her positive attitude was very motivative, encouraging others to work harder.
meanings.sent3: The motivative poster on the wall reminded everyone to keep pushing forward.
meanings.sent4: The sunset over the ocean was so motivative, it inspired a sense of wonder and awe.
meanings.sent5: The coach's words were incredibly motivative, leaving a lasting impact on the team.

meanings.sent1: The motivative music in the background set the perfect mood for creativity.
meanings.sent2: His motivative actions spoke louder than any words of encouragement.
meanings.sent3: The motivative movie had everyone in the audience feeling ready to take on the world.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the night sky had a motivative effect on the young dreamer, sparking ambition.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's motivative approach to learning made the subject come alive for the students.
